sentences.english: Today, there are thousands of women players in the Chinese Football Association.
sentences.chinese: 現在有上千女足球運動員在中國足協。

sentences.english: Yes. You may find the logo of the Chinese Football Association on each of them.
sentences.chinese: 有的，我們每件行李上都貼有中國足球協會的會標。

sentences.english: Several senior officials from the Chinese Football Association have been arrested over match-fixing allegations.
sentences.chinese: 幾名中國足協的高官由於操縱假球受到指控並被逮捕。

sentences.english: The corridors of the CFA are eerily quiet.
sentences.chinese: 中國足協辦公樓的走廊平靜得可怕。

sentences.english: New soccer leader named in scandal-rocked CFA.
sentences.chinese: 醜聞轟動的中國足協任命新的掌門人。

sentences.english: China's soccer team, by contrast, is a perennial disappointment.
sentences.chinese: 相比較而言，中國國足卻叫中國人連年失望。

sentences.english: Chinese male football team matched against Brail politely in 08 games.
sentences.chinese: 在08奧運會上，中國足球隊很禮貌地和巴西競賽。

sentences.english: I hope the team of China will be a strong team one day.
sentences.chinese: 我希望中國足球隊終有一天成爲強隊。

definition: Barca (nickname for FC Barcelona)/Baza (town in Grenada, Spain)
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
(of a sports competition or match) to commence/(of a war or battle) to break out/to perform acrobatic or choreographed fighting (in Chinese opera)/to brawl/to come to blows
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
